image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: At least 7 dead, dozens injured in bus crash in Mississippi
item.description: A tragic accident in Mississippi saw a bus veering off Interstate 20 and overturning, resulting in seven deaths, including a 6-year-old boy and his 16-year-old sister from Guatemala. Thirty-seven passengers sustained injuries and were hospitalized. The bus was carrying mainly Central American passengers. Authorities are investigating the cause of the crash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Baltimore tech entrepreneur Pava LaPere's murderer sentenced to three life terms
item.description: Jason Billingsley, who pleaded guilty to the first-degree murder of tech entrepreneur Pava LaPere in September 2023, received three life sentences. Two will be served concurrently. Billingsley also pleaded guilty to attempted murder in a prior incident. Critics have questioned his early release from prison for a 2013 rape, prompting legislative changes in Maryland.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Trump's dance moves at Moms for Liberty event go viral
item.description: During the Moms for Liberty event, Donald Trump ended his appearance with a viral dance routine, sparking mixed reactions on social media. While some praised his moves, others expressed disapproval. He also criticised Vice President Kamala Harris, calling her 'defective' and questioning her limited media presence, to highlight her shortcomings, according to him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mary Trump condemns uncle Donald Trump's behavior at Arlington ceremony, slams lack of legal action
item.description: Mary Trump has criticized her uncle, Donald Trump, following an alleged altercation involving his staff at Arlington National Cemetery. On August 26, during a wreath-laying ceremony, Trump's staff reportedly tried to film a restricted area and pushed an Arlington employee. Despite a police report, no charges were filed. Trumpâ€™s campaign denied the allegations, attributing the incident to a misunderstanding. Mary Trump condemned the absence of legal action, calling her uncle a despicable narcissist.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rare green dinosaur fossil discovered in Utah
item.description: Unearthed in southeastern Utah, a rare 150-million-year-old green dinosaur fossil, temporarily named 'Gnatalie,' was reassembled by the Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County and is now exhibited in Los Angeles. This nearly complete sauropod, believed to be of the genus diplodocus, is 75 feet long and weighs five tons. The green hue is a result of volcanic activity that altered its bones. It will headline a new museum wing opening in November.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Philippines and Chinese vessels collide in South China Sea
item.description: China has accused a Philippine Coast Guard vessel of deliberately colliding with a Chinese ship in the South China Sea. The Philippines refutes the claim, alleging that the Chinese vessel intentionally rammed the Philippine ship multiple times. This incident adds to rising tensions over contested maritime areas, involving multiple regional players, including the US, Japan, and others.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Grim survival tactic: Why is Namibia planning to kill over 700 animals, including hundreds of elephants and zebras
item.description: Namibia plans to slaughter 723 wild animals, including elephants, to provide food for almost half its population facing a severe hunger crisis caused by the worst drought in a century. The strategy also seeks to reduce risky human-wildlife encounters as both compete for dwindling resources amid the drought's intensification.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: State emergency declared in Greek port city after massive dead fish crisis
item.description: Volos in Greece is dealing with a state of emergency as large quantities of dead fish have accumulated in its port. Triggered by last year's floods, this crisis has significantly affected the local economy and tourism. Cleanup efforts are ongoing, and authorities are investigating to understand the situation better and prevent future occurrences.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man arrested for assaulting Jewish students at University of Pittsburgh
item.description: At the University of Pittsburgh, a man attacked a group of Jewish students using a bottle near the Cathedral of Learning. Two students were injured and treated at the scene. The suspect has been arrested. The university is working with Jewish organizations to support the affected students, emphasizing that violence and antisemitism are not acceptable.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan lodges formal protest over Chinese vessel presence in Kagoshima prefecture
item.description: Japan has formally protested to China after a Chinese survey vessel entered its territorial waters near Kagoshima Prefecture without authorization. The vessel was detected early Saturday and stayed in the area for nearly two hours. This incident has intensified Japan's concerns about China's assertive actions and its increasing military ties with Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Exotic animals rescued from smuggling at Turkish-Greek border
item.description: Turkish customs officials in Edirne found a mid-sized sedan with Greek plates carrying exotic animals from Greece. The car contained kangaroos, alpacas, a Patagonian mara, parrots, and flying squirrels. The vehicle's driver, Yuksel D., was detained, and the animals will be transferred to the Directorate of Nature Conservation and National Parks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hong Kong arrests two for sedition under national security law
item.description: Hong Kong police arrested two people for sedition under a new national security law, alleging they spread hatred against Chinese and local authorities. These arrests come shortly after Stand News editors were convicted of sedition. Critics argue that the sedition law is used to target dissenters and silence government critics.

item.title: Balochistan: Rights body condemns extrajudicial killings, forced disappearances; seeks international probe
item.description: The Baloch National Movement's human rights department, Paank, has expressed alarm over the forced disappearance of 11 individuals and the extrajudicial killing of nine more by Pakistani forces in Balochistan. Victims such as Fayaz Jatag and Nisar Ahmed underline a severe humanitarian crisis that calls for global attention and urgent action.

item.title: Iran village records Earth's highest heat index at 82.2Â° C
item.description: A heat index of 82.2Â°C and a dew point of 36.1Â°C potentially were recorded in southern Iran, possibly setting world records. US meteorologist Colin McCarthy reported these readings and expressed doubts about their accuracy, prompting calls for an investigation. These extreme conditions have raised health concerns due to high humidity and temperatures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Venezuela plunges into darkness: Nationwide blackout hits all 24 states, extreme heat drives people outdoors without power
item.description: Major power outage hits Venezuelaâ€™s capital, with Maduro government blaming â€˜sabotageâ€™

item.title: Russia says five killed, 46 injured in Ukraine strike on Belgorod
item.description: A late Friday attack by Ukraine on Belgorod, a southwestern city in Russia, resulted in five deaths and 46 injuries, including seven children hospitalized. Dashboard video captures the moment of the explosion. A criminal case has been opened. Ukraine has frequently targeted Belgorod since the Russia-Ukraine conflict began in February 2022.

item.title: PS5 purchase video goes viral: Salesman hugs overwhelmed customer, netizens react to celebration
item.description: A video has gone viral of a man's deeply emotional reaction upon purchasing a PlayStation 5. The customer's joy overflows after completing the transaction, leading to a celebratory hug with the salesman. The touching scene has garnered admiration worldwide, with many praising the emotional moment and the salesman's supportive gesture.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russian helicopter with 22 on board goes missing in Kamchatka Peninsula
item.description: A Russian Mi-8T helicopter, with 22 on board including 19 passengers, went missing in the Kamchatka Peninsula. Departing from a base near the Vachkazhets volcano, the helicopter failed to make contact at the scheduled time. Russiaâ€™s Federal Air Transport Agency has initiated a search operation to locate the missing aircraft.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japanâ€™s bold move to 4-day workweek: Will it end the â€˜work yourself to deathâ€™ culture?
item.description: Japan is shifting towards a four-day workweek to combat labor shortages and overwork. Despite government initiatives promoting flexibility and work-life balance, only a small fraction of companies have adopted it. Some firms and employees report success, though critics worry about potentially longer hours and decreased pay. Engagement remains a key concern.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vanceâ€™s haircut is making waves â€” and not in a good way!
item.description: Republican Vice Presidential nominee JD Vanceâ€™s new haircut has unexpectedly captured social media interest. Amid a campaign visit to Philadelphia, Vance addressed a past controversial remark but found his hairstyle to be the main talking point. His visit also coincided with a rally by Vice President Kamala Harris as the 2024 presidential race heats up.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
